111121211211.content:
Simba rubbed a small paw along his taught bloated stomach. It felt so good, and he knew that as he got bigger, it felt so much better.

But how could he get more pregnant, he wondered? He drank from the pond, thinking of all his options, not even noticing that he had emptied the entirety of the small lake.

His stomach was enormous and swollen, sloshing heavily side to side as he walked back to Timon and Pumbaa.

"Jeeze, kid," said Timon, aghast at the cub's new and bigger size. "What, did your babies get pregant too?"

Simba blushed a bit, and was about to speak when Timon put his hands and head against the massive gut. "Hello in there!!" the meerkat shouted, at which point the massive kicking from inside made him bounce back. "Kid... I think maybe there's even more in there than yesterday!"

"I think somehow... some of my cubs have gotten pregnant," he said, rubbing what little of his belly he could reach.

"Whuh, buh, zuhguh..." Timon had broken, and was sputtering.

"Aww, c'mon Timon," said Pumbaa, "I think it's adorable. He's going to have his own pride already!" He nuzzled the other side of Simba's belly, before shooting up. "Wait a minute, I'm having one of those idea thingies again... there's ten or so in there already, right? Well if each of them have ten, and each of THEM have 10... Boy, you're gonna be the size of an elephant!"

"Of a mountain!" Corrected Timon. "How did this happen??"

"I don't know, but... I think I like it," said Simba quietly. "I want to be more pregnant, do you guys think you can help me?"

The two looked at each other and nodded in resolve. "Simba," said Timon slamming a fist on an imaginary table, "We're gonna help you get as big as you want! And I know just what you need..."

1111212112111.content:
The trio set off on a journey to Rafiki's tree, Simba's belly so low and heavy that when it swung between his legs it the rounded edge of it grazed the ground.

"You feeling okay there?" asked Timon, rubbing gently on the small of Simba's back.

"It's fine, feels so weird but good," said Simba. "I think they're making me stronger carrying them, my back doesn't really hurt anymore."

"And you're sure you want more? I think I can see you growing before my eyes!"

Simba looked cautiously at his belly, it did seem to rise and fall gently with his breath, and ever so slightly did it rise more than it fell.

"Yeah, I do, I want this thing big." He rubbed his taught stomach with one paw before thumping it gently. "Uh oh," he said, looking worried at his belly.

"What?" said Pumbaa, stopping. Timon held out both hands, equally worried. "What is it?"

"I think I just sort of woke them up, I can feel them all kicking and moving... all of them are really moving a lot, now."

The two looked at the cub from either side; indeed, his stomach was writhing a bit with the occasional jutting kick from within.

"Don't worry, we'll take care of this," said Pumbaa, and places his snout up against one side. Whispering and singing sweet lullabies, he gently pushed on Simba's huge stomach, rocking it hanging from underneath him. Timon pushed on the other side and attempted to join in on the lullaby singing, and together they swung the gut and the cubs within until they seemed to nestle in and quiet down again.

They remained mostly dormant for the rest of the journey, and nearing twilight they saw the tree looming up before them.

"Do you think he's in there?" asked Simba timidly.

"I know a sure fire to find out," said Timon, and stepped forward clearing his throat. "Hey crazy moooonkeeeeeey!" he shouted up into the trees.

Several bonks and thuds followed, and Rafiki seemed to fall out of control from a low branch before flipping and landing expertly at the last possible fraction of a second. He held out his hand, and his staff fell into it.

"Young prince!" said the monkey with reverence. "I see you are starting to accept your destiny, just as I have seen, to start a new and wonderful pride..." He held up a strange fruit and turned it side to side, before opening it, a mass of seeds spilling out. "Still, even I couldn't have seen just how big your pride is turning out to be... I'd say you have nearly two dozen inside you, by now?"

"What?" said Timon and Pumbaa, simultaneously. "You mean he's still getting more pregnant?"

"That's actually what I came to talk to you about, Rafiki," said Simba. "I want to know if I can get even more pregnant, I love this feeling in my stomach and I want to know if I can get even bigger."

"Even bigger, child?" Rafiki ran one long-fingered hand over the belly, and the stimulation made Simba sigh gently. "I can, I can, but how much bigger do you want to be?"

Simba furrowed his brow in resolve and smiled, nodding his head. "You heard me, I want this thing to be as big as it can possibly get," he said, and thumped his stomach. He was proud, and could feel air puffing his chest out as he smiled with a strong, narrow gaze. He could feel his cubs within growing restless again and starting to kick, spreading pleasure over the surface of his taught gut with every squirm.

"It sounds dangerous," said Rafiki, mixing the copious seeds from the strange fruit into a shell as a makeshift cup, and stirring them with leaves and bark and juice. "But I can do it. An order from my prince to make the biggest pride in Africa, and I shall obey. Drink this and rest," he said, and gently offered the cup in the palms of his outstretched hands.

Simba took it in one paw and drank it in one gulp, licking his lips. His stomach tightened, and then gurgled and sloshed as it swung from left to right.

Timon and Pumbaa backed away, and towards each other, worried as they stared at the young lion's swinging, hanging gut. But Simba didn't care. He stood with his head high in regal sureness, his eyes closed, and moaning only gently at the pleasure. Then he rolled over onto one side and slept with the setting sun.

The trio watched as even before their eyes Simba's pregnant stomach started to grow in heaving swells. 132.content:
Scar awoke, panting. Looking outside, he saw that it was still dark, the stars glowing brightly. This wasn't a particularly comforting scene though, because this was exactly how the dream had started too. He wondered for a moment whether it had been a dream at all, then waved it off, yes it must have been a dream, a particularly vivid one, but still a dream. He shuddered, the memory still very vivid in his mind...
-------
Scar awoke fitfully, feeling something was wrong, but unable to place what was wrong. Looking up at the doorway, he thought he saw movement, and so picking his way carefully between the slumbering lionesses, he went to investigate. Once outside he looked around, but could see nothing unusual, at least until he turned to re-enter the cave, and suddenly found Mufasa standing there, "M-Mufasa, b-but you-you're."

"Dead, yes," Mufasa said severely, "by your paw, brother, by your paw." Scar tried to speak, but found himself unable to utter a sound, though his brother made up for that, by saying, "you will come with me." And suddenly the slim lion found his body to no longer be under control as he followed his stout, powerful brother down into the silent grasslands.

After a few minutes he tried to ask, "what-"

"You will be silent," Mufasa replied, And Scar suddenly found himself unable to utter a word. The further they got from Pride Rock, the more confused the dark lion became, where were they going, and to what end? At length, they came upon the gorge, and he began to get an inkling, did his brother intend to get revenge for the murder by doing the same to him here?

This thought was proven false when Mufasa led Scar down into the gorge, right to the spot where in life his body had landed. Once there, he said, "ancestors, I have brought you my brother."

Scar looked around fearfully as the walls began to change, becoming faces, some of which he recognised instantly, his mother and father, but most he took longer over before realising who they were, and some he didn't recognise at all. Suddenly, the air seemed filled with whispers, 'evil, crime, punishment, murder, restitution, fiend'. He tried to shout out, to deny the words, but found himself still unable to utter a sound.

"Brother," Mufasa said, bringing Scar to face him as the whispers continued, "what you did was wrong, and so the you will be punished." There was a pause as the slender lion tried desperately to speak, but only his brother was able to, "but the gods don't demand death, only restitution."

This puzzled Scar for several moments, so that he just watched as Mufasa walked around behind him. Then suddenly his brother was on his back, bearing him to the ground. He struggled feebly at fist, then more strongly as something warm and wet began probe her rear beneath his tail. But it was too late, for even as the dark lion struggled, his brother found his mark.

Scar wanted to scream as Mufasa thrust into him, but all that emerged was a pitiful mewl. Scar continued to struggle for a few moments, before a new situation was brought to his attention, that of his belly. At first it was just in the centre, but as the moments passed, it began to spread outwards. As this continued, his brother said, "you will be my restitution brother, you will bring me forth again."

Scar struggled futilely for several minutes as Mufasa continued to thrust, inflating his belly, and then suddenly the dark lion felt his brother step away from him and thump to the ground. Getting up, the dark lion was taken aback to see that his brother had fallen over into exactly the posture he'd died in. Noth that this was the only change of course, for looking back at himself, he saw his normally slender frame sporting a bloated belly, and then to hammer home the situation, it suddenly gave a kick.
-------
Scar ran a paw down his flank, admiring its slender profile, and imagining with some distaste, the thought of it being bloated out as in the dream. He quickly threw the thought aside, no, it had been but a vivid dream, that was all. Even as he lay down again so sleep though, he couldn't rid himself of a slight feeling of doubt, but that mattered little, it wouldn't prevent him from sleeping.
-------
A week passed, and then another, and for Scar things were going well, at least until...

14131.content:
It was a warm, pleasant evening in the Pridelands, as its eldest Prince determinedly padded along one of the kingdom’s borders, his large paws sending up small spirals of dust from the dry earth. With his father, Ahadi, entering the latter stages of middle-age, and he himself rapidly approaching adulthood, Mufasa had been given the duty of patrolling the lands in place of the King. The elder lion’s idea had two benefits. It gave the heir some much-needed experience for when the crown would eventually pass to him, and it also allowed the King and Queen to spend more time together in the evenings than they had in years. Admittedly, his father’s intelligent diplomacy had left the Pridelands with few unfriendly faces, so his task was relatively easy. In fact, Mufasa had only been sent out this particular evening because a rogue had been scented in the area.

Certainly, Mufasa would do a good job of intimidating any interloper into second-guessing himself. His golden body was very large and stocky, blessed with great strength that caused his haunches to bulge with each step. Despite being a season or two from leaving adolescence, his thick, red mane covered most of his head, neck and shoulders, framing his broad face and equally wide muzzle. He was truly an impressive sight.

He kept his amber gaze vaguely over the horizon, but his eyes were not focussed. Instead, his thoughts were concentrated on a certain lioness.

Sarabi.

Just thinking of her name caused a great warmth to flood his chest, and yet simultaneously send innumerable tingles dancing down his spine. It was no secret that he utterly adored her; after all, they had been in love with one another for well over a year, ever since he had revealed his feelings to the dark-tan lioness during a late visit to the waterhole. Since then, they had been almost inseparable, even more-so than they had been as cubs

She was an…unusual choice for his affections, considering that most lions his age would consider her friend, Sarafina, to be more attractive. He had to admit that the light lioness was certainly very pretty, and had an infectiously happy outlook, but he found Sarabi much more enticing. It was the image of her strong, graceful form that elicited great desires from deep within, some of which he almost felt the need to chastise himself for they were so decadent. It was her deep wisdom and intellect, and the way that she never seemed bored when he discussed the aspects of his upcoming kingship with her. It was her understated sense of humour, and lingering cubbish mischievous side that would more often that not break up a monotonous time and bring a smile to their muzzles. It was her capacity to care for almost anyone, and to brighten his day with tender licks and nuzzles. It was that gentle smile of hers, and her soft voice that could be either sultry or regal with the merest change of emphasis. But, most of all, it was the way that everything just felt so much more complete when they did it together.

And one thing that felt most complete was-

Mufasa shook his head violently, and re-focussed his eyes on the landscape ahead. As much as he would have liked to visit those particular memories, he had a duty to attend to. It would be difficult to ward off rogues with his mind in a loving, lustful haze. With a sigh, and a stationary moment to fully cleanse his thoughts, he ploughed on to the very corner of the kingdom.

The sun was almost embracing the earth once again by the time he reached the furthest reaches of the Pridelands. The large adolescent was just about to turn around, when he noticed a brown form in the distance. A brown, leonine form with a darker patch. A brown, dark-maned lion that looked to be his size, though probably a little older, dining on what appeared to be the remains of a plump gazelle from a herd that Mufasa remembered passing not too long ago.

The Prince felt his breath catch in his chest. As he watched the lion continue to eat, blissfully unaware of his presence, he felt something brewing deep within him. It was a…
14131.title: He has an incident with a rogue

141311.content:
...Deep, threatening roar, how dare this rogue hunt in their lands!

The rogue looked up when he heard Mufasa roar. For just a moment he cringed slightly and thought of running, but then realised that the roar, though loud, was a fraction high to be a mature lion, so this was likely a young one, or perhaps a male who was slighter than usual, neither of which would be overmuch trouble to deal with.

Mufasa's ire only rose as he approached the rogue, the male was just standing there instead of running, which he considered unforgivable, rogues were cowards after all weren't they? So full of self-importance was the prince that he wasn't thinking straight, and thus he didn't realise until for too late that the rogue was in fact a little larger than he, and quite mature, perhaps half way between Mufasa and his father Ahadi is terms of age. Even then, this didn't stop him from saying, "who are you, rogue, what are you doing here?"

"My name's Jaali, youngster," the rogue replied coolly, "and as for what I'm doing here, that should be obvious, even to you."

"Well your meal ends right now, understood," Mufasa replied, "if you haven't started running by the time-"

"Youngster, if I was you I wouldn't be trying to make demands right now," Jaali cut in, "I'm bigger than you, I'm stronger than you, and I'm a more experienced fighter than you, so buzz off and let me finish my meal, and I might just let you live."

Mufasa was silent a moment as he realised that the rogue, Jaali did indeed have the advantage, "a-and if I were to leave you be?"

"Fine by me," Jaali replied, then paused, "except you're not another rogue are you?"

"W-why does that matter," Mufasa asked nervously.

"Because the last thing I want is to be run out by the local king," Jaali replied, "and if I let you go now then you'll run straight back to him and tell him exactly where I am, and that's something I'm not about to let-hey, come back here!"

Mufasa ran as fast as he could, terrified of what the rogue might have planned for him. Unfortunately for the young prince, his relatively sheltered life mean that he hadn't yet developed the taut, hard musculature needed to run down prey on a regular basis, and so despite the head start it wasn't long before he found himself on the ground, with Jaali atop him. Though he was fearful of his fate, the young lion was too busy gasping for breath to speak.

"Now normally I'd do something nasty, possibly even lethal at this point," Jaali said, "and indeed I'm going to leave you with something permanent today, but you're lucky, because you've caught be when I'm not in a killing mood."
-------
Mufasa felt queasy as he stumbled home, not only was his shoulder throbbing from the deep gashes, but his rear was not much better, the rogue really had been rough with him. Not that he was keen for anyone to know that had happened, losing to a rogue who was larger and older than he was hardly shameful, but the 'punishment' he'd been dealt was shameful in the extreme.

"Great Kings of the past, Mufasa, what happened," Ahadi said, when he saw his son's condition, "are you okay?"

"Apart from this shoulder, fairly much," Mufasa replied, "as to the 'what', I met a rogue who was bigger than I was."

"Is this rogue still around," Ahadi asked, concerned.

"Well I didn't manage to kill him, so I suppose so," Mufasa replied, "I'm not going to be up to much for a while though."

"Understood," Ahadi said, "will you need to get Rafiki to look at that shoulder?"

"I-I think it would be best," Mufasa replied.
-------
"I heard what happened," Sarabi said, coming forward immediately after Rafiki left, "I'm sorry-"

"Don't be," Mufasa replied, "it was my own stupid fault I got into that fight, not yours or anyone else's."

Sarabi was silent a moment, then said, "well, you know I'll always be here for you."

"And for that I'm eternally grateful," Mufasa replied, wondering if perhaps he could reveal the other outcome of the encounter to her, he didn't want to carry the knowledge alone - apart from Rafiki, and the mandrill didn't really count on that score - and he didn't dare tell his family, but just maybe she was trustworthy enough?

"Hey numb nuts..." Shenzi laid down next to Banzai on the cool den floor, giving him a soft lick to the cheek. "You feelin' any better?"

"What do you think?" He growled in reply.

"Hey now, don't get smart with me, boy." Shenzi warned him. "I'm only worried for ya. Be nice."

Ed crept cautiously into the den, a zebra haunch in his jaws.

Slowly, he approached the other two hyenas, before laying the peace offering down at Banzai's paws.

"Aw, now ain't that sweet?" Shenzi grinned.

Ed sat with his head cocked slightly to the side, looking at Banzai expectantly. He was hoping this would get him off the hook.

"Get lost." Banzai growled at him.

Ed frowned and mumbled something sadly.

"Go." Banzai growled again.

Ed's ears drooped down and he slunk out of the den with his head down and his tail tucked between his legs.

"Now that just ain't fair, Banzai." Shenzi sighed. "Ain't his fault."

"Ain't his fault!?" Banzai demanded. "How ain't it his fault? He's the one that did it ain't he? You see me lettin' any other males climb on top of me?"

Shenzi rolled her eyes then rolled over onto her back.

"Would it make you feel better if I let you mate me?" She asked with a sly grin.

"Not really." Banzai admitted, digging into the zebra haunch Ed had left for him.

Sure he hadn't exactly accepted the peace offering but he had to eat something. After all, he was eating for two now. Or three, depending on how many pups there were growing within him.

Shenzi rolled back over to where she was sitting up again and laid her head down on her paws.

"You sure are a hard one to please ain't ya?" She muttered.

Banzai rolled his eyes. It was true though. Shenzi had tried almost everything she could think of to cheer him up but so far nothing had proved affective.

"You know Eddie didn't mean for this to happen." Shenzi told him then. "He loves you. Just like I do. Now why ya gotta treat him this way?"

"His fault." Banzai growled.

"Maybe but it ain't so bad is it?" Shenzi tried. "You always wanted to be a Dad right? And it'll be nice to finally have another girl around here."

Banzai muttered something under his breath.

"What was that, tough guy?" Shenzi asked.

"I said it's a boy." Banzai muttered louder.

"Oh sure. Cause you know that don't ya?" Shenzi chuckled, putting a paw to his belly to feel the pup's little movements.

"Quit it." Banzai blushed, embarrassed.

"Nope. Think I'll just keep feelin'." Shenzi grinned. "What're ya gonna do about it, huh?"

Banzai put his head down and looked away from her.

Ed whimpered from outside the cave, desperately wanting to join his mates.

Banzai rolled his eyes, frustrated still.

"Let him come in." Shenzi pleaded. "Poor thing's had enough of your torture already."

Ed whimpered sadly again from outside. It was starting to rain.

Banzai sighed.

"Get in before I change my mind." He called to Ed.

The damaged Hyena wandered into their den slowly, shaking himself off near the entrance.

"Commere' Eddie." Shenzi urged him. "Feel our little puppy."

"Nuh uh." Banzai growled in protest until Shenzi growled back at him, silencing the upset male.

Ed slunk forward cautiously.

"It's okay, sweet thang. Come on over here." Shenzi assured him.

Ed chuckled softly and approached his two mates, laying down next to them and putting a paw out to feel Banzai's belly.

The pup was strong. That much was certain.

Ed gave a delighted giggle when their unborn little one nudged his paw from inside Banzai.

The other male laid with his ears drooped and a frown on his face.

He figured he'd just have to accept this and move on. There really was nothing else he could do about it.

Plus, it wouldn't be totally bad to have another little male running around the den. Especially now that they'd been allowed into the pridelands.

Still, though, why did anything everything always have to happen to him? And only him?

.........

"Breathe, honey." Shenzi nuzzled Banzai's face while the laboring male panted in pain on the den floor.

"I can't..." He grunted in agony.

Ed frowned and gave a worried whimper.

"It's okay, Hun. He'll be fine." Shenzi assured her other mate.

Banzai groaned as his belly contracted again.

There was a lot of fluid and nasty stuff involved in this giving birth thing and he didn't like it.

That wasn't the worst of it though. The worst of it was the unbearable pain he was currently in.

"Shenz I want it out...." He growled, pain clear in his voice.

"He's coming. Just breathe for now." The she hyena coached him, nuzzling his face gently.

Ed came forward and gave him a soft lick to the forehead, trying to give a little encouragement.

Banzai huffed and panted, shutting his eyes against the pain.

"Come on." Shenzi encouraged him. "Just a little longer."

"Shenzi I...I can't...It's..." He groaned, his body stiffening up.

"That's it. Push." Shenzi coached him.

Banzai bared down, groaning and lifting his leg up slightly.

Ed licked at his birth canal, encouraging the pup to come out.

"Oww..." Banzai whined.

"You're almost there. Keep pushing." Shenzi told him, smiling as she watched a tiny black head begin to emerge from her mate.

"Aww look at our little gal." Shenzi smiled proudly as she watched her mate clean their newborn pup.

Ed barked happily and ran, jumping in excitement in circles around the den.

"Calm down, you damn numbskull." Banzai growled at Ed, continuing to lick the tiny new life as it searched for a nipple to latch on to.

"Ooh what should be call her?" Shenzi mused, getting closer to get a better look at the pup.

"I know." Banzai replied, continuing to lick the little suckling pup. "He's a male."

Ed came closer and nuzzled Banzai before licking and nuzzling their pup. He was definitely a proud daddy.

They were all proud of little Janja. That much was certain.
